poem:
Title: Peace so Elusive

In Gaza, a wide sun burns,
Tel Aviv, Beirut, Sana'a turn -
as if the clocks could still the conflict's churn,
Their ceasefires echo, bright and stern.
Hamas, UN, the tables turn,
key demands, like leaves, adjourn.
Yet in the hearts where hope yearns,
bleak remain the lessons learned.
Hope, a fragile, stubborn fern,
sprouts 'midst the ruin, taciturn.
